details.description: You may need to tell DVLA if you've had a catheter ablation
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you’ve had a catheter ablation.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. However, you shouldn’t drive for 2 days after your treatment. You may drive after this time if you don’t have any other medical condition that could affect your driving. If you’re unsure, check with your doctor.

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to them. The address is on the form.

Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 394KB)
